intro: Ditassa ottohuberi, commonly known as Ottohuber's ditassa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched.
